main event: On February 27, 1959, a heart-shaped, white-buff object the size of a dime was observed at a very high altitude without apparent forward speed. It was initially seen on radar and then visually, estimated to be over 60,000 feet altitude. The object remained stationary and exhibited no trail nor exhaust features.
interesting points: The object was observed by two naval aviators flying F4D aircraft, and there was no other air traffic in the immediate area.
One pilot initially sighted the object on radar, while the other observed it visually at an estimated altitude in excess of 60,000 feet.
The object appeared to hang in the air without any perceptible changes in altitude or forward speed.
Both pilots reported clear weather conditions with unlimited ceiling and visibility, no cloud cover, and no thunderstorms in the area.
Preliminary analysis suggested that the object was likely a weather balloon due to its high altitude and apparent lack of forward speed.
sighted object: heart-shaped, white-buff object at very high altitude
